description:
Means “agreement” in Japanese. More literally, it means to unite, or join together.

CJK Ideographs are characters used in Chinese, Japanese and Korean languages. Their writing systems all completely or partly use Chinese characters.
apple_vendor_description: The Japanese Passing Grade button emoji on Apple devices is a bold, circular symbol of achievement, featuring a distinct 'Go' (ÂêàÊ†º) character rendered in crisp white against a vibrant green background.  Apple's design language imbues this button with a subtle 3D effect, giving it a raised, tactile appearance that suggests a seal of approval.  Its clean lines and bright colors make it an instantly recognizable mark of success, perfect for celebrating academic milestones or any significant accomplishment within messages exchanged on Apple devices.
